---
title: 3D Visualization
---

The 3D plots use [Plotly](https://plotly.com/python/)—interactive out of the box. Drag to rotate, scroll to zoom.

```{python}
from ggsegpy import ggseg3d, dk

ggseg3d(atlas=dk())
```

## Camera positions

Use `pan_camera()` with human-readable view names:

```{python}
from ggsegpy import pan_camera

fig = ggseg3d(atlas=dk())
fig = pan_camera(fig, "left lateral")
fig
```

Available views:

- `"left lateral"`, `"right lateral"` — outside of each hemisphere
- `"left medial"`, `"right medial"` — inside (midline)
- `"left superior"`, `"right superior"` — top view
- `"left inferior"`, `"right inferior"` — bottom view
- `"left anterior"`, `"right anterior"` — front view
- `"left posterior"`, `"right posterior"` — back view

```{python}
fig = ggseg3d(atlas=dk())
fig = pan_camera(fig, "right medial")
fig
```

## Backgrounds

Dark backgrounds work well for presentations:

```{python}
from ggsegpy import set_background

fig = ggseg3d(atlas=dk())
fig = set_background(fig, "black")
fig = pan_camera(fig, "left lateral")
fig
```

## Glass brains

When showing subcortical structures, a transparent cortical surface provides context:

```{python}
from ggsegpy import aseg, add_glassbrain

fig = ggseg3d(atlas=aseg())
fig = add_glassbrain(fig, opacity=0.1)
fig = pan_camera(fig, "left lateral")
fig
```

The glass brain shows where subcortical structures sit within the cortex:

```{python}
fig = ggseg3d(atlas=aseg())
fig = add_glassbrain(fig, opacity=0.15)
fig = set_background(fig, "#1a1a2e")
fig = pan_camera(fig, "left anterior")
fig
```

## Filtering hemispheres

Show only one hemisphere:

```{python}
fig = ggseg3d(atlas=dk(), hemisphere="left")
fig = pan_camera(fig, "left lateral")
fig
```

## Legend control

```{python}
from ggsegpy import remove_legend, set_legend

fig = ggseg3d(atlas=dk())
fig = remove_legend(fig)
fig = pan_camera(fig, "left lateral")
fig
```

```{python}
fig = ggseg3d(atlas=aseg())
fig = set_legend(fig, show=True)
fig
```

## White matter tracts

```{python}
from ggsegpy import tracula

fig = ggseg3d(atlas=tracula())
fig = set_background(fig, "black")
fig = pan_camera(fig, "left lateral")
fig
```

## Chaining functions

All modifier functions return the figure:

```{python}
fig = ggseg3d(atlas=aseg())
fig = add_glassbrain(fig, opacity=0.1)
fig = set_background(fig, "black")
fig = pan_camera(fig, "left anterior")
fig
```

## Saving figures

```{python}
#| eval: false
fig = ggseg3d(atlas=dk())
fig = pan_camera(fig, "left lateral")

# Interactive HTML
fig.write_html("brain_interactive.html")

# Static PNG (requires kaleido)
fig.write_image("brain_static.png", width=1200, height=800)
```
